RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the border patrol checkpoint: U.S. Border Patrol Checkpoint on Interstate 35 near Laredo, Texas

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: appellant in the case, arguing for excusable neglect due to untimely filing and a party in the legal proceedings, seeking appeal of suppressed evidence, Plaintiff-Appellant, country of citizenship, prosecuting party, filed motions for reconsideration and appealed the denial of its motion to suppress, appellant contending lack of appellate jurisdiction, concedes failure to meet 30-day deadline but argues materiality requirement, prosecutor, a party filing notice to appeal and certifying its appeal, arguing that a post-verdict suppression order fails to become material until deciding to grant acquittal. Also, found an indicted suspect's allegedly false allegations in an arson case to be 'substantial proof of a fact material in the proceedings', and is aware of various pathways after granting a post-guilty verdict suppression, entitled to appeal both the order granting the motion to suppress and the order setting aside the verdict of guilty. Bound by the law of the case doctrine for judicial efficiency. The appellant whose appeal is dismissed due to lack of an adequate case or controversy. Additionally, has held that the 30 days start with the entry of the judgment or order in the docket per Rule 4(b), not the rendering of the judgment or order
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Border Patrol: law enforcement agency operating the checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Border Patrol Checkpoint on Interst: location where Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso was stopped and questioned by Agent Jesus Garcia
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.City of Laredo: location of the federal grand jury and border patrol checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: party entitled to appeal suppression of evidence in criminal cases, appellant in the current case, governed by Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure for appeals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure: governs appellate procedure, specifically the timing and certification requirements for appeals by the government, including rules for filing notice of appeal, federal rule of appellate procedure, requires filing of notice of appeal within 30 days after entry of judgment or order being appealed. Also governs the basis for the United States of America's ability to appeal suppression of evidence in criminal cases
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals: court that reviews appeals from district courts, including those related to excusable neglect and good cause for tardy filings, makes determinations on excusable neglect or good cause for untimely appeals, allows Government appeals from post-verdict judgments of acquittal, dismisses the United States of America's appeal due to lack of an adequate case or controversy
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: trial court where the case is initially heard, makes findings on factual questions and rules on motions to suppress, issues orders that may be appealed, had sensibly first made its finding on the factual question of guilt or innocence, and then ruled on the motion to suppress
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso: the defendant in the case, Defendant-Appellee, filed a motion for reconsideration of the United States of America's original denial of the motion to suppress, contends that United States of America lacks appellate jurisdiction, also contends that the law does not permit appeals from judgments of acquittal. Successfully argued that the law of the case doctrine precludes the United States of America from presenting an adequate case or controversy under Article III
a company mentioned in a referenced court case, specifically Signal Oil & Gas Co. v. Barge W-701, which discussed the law of the case doctrine
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Jesus Garcia: border patrol agent who stopped and questioned Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso, stated that certain cities are common destinations for illegal aliens and 'disposable' vehicles are often used for smuggling drugs or aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Merriam Webster Online Dictionary: reference source defining legal terms, specifically defines a Hobson's choice as 'an apparently free choice when there is no real alternative'
